description: Border radius values based on ComPOSt Design System, optimized for mobile app use

3px.description: Extra small radius for tiny components like checkboxes

small.description: Use a small radius to soften the corners of areas you don't want to look like cards or boxes

medium.description: Medium is the default radius for most elements
medium.usage: Default radius for buttons, cards, inputs, and most UI elements

large.description: Use a large radius when an element is used as a Container for other elements and pieces of content
large.usage: Container elements, cards that wrap content, modals

full.description: Use full radius to create a circle (on squares) or pill shape (on rectangles)

hierarchy.description: The purpose of radius rules is to highlight the container nesting level visually â€“ the more the container envelops, the bigger its radius. This serves as a general guideline rather than a strict rule.

correlation.description: Radius values are mathematically correlated with the spacing scale for design system consistency
